abstract: Goldman plans to name its managing directors — a senior rank just below the partner level — every two years, instead of annually, the firm told employees in a memorandum reviewed by DealBook.
snippet: Goldman plans to name its managing directors — a senior rank just below the partner level — every two years, instead of annually, the firm told employees in a memorandum reviewed by DealBook.
lead_paragraph: Goldman Sachs has changed the process for selecting managing directors, instituting a new schedule for bestowing the title on employees.

headline.main: Goldman to Skip a Year to Name Managing Directors
